attack_paths.justification: This attack path exploits the critical CVE-2020-2574 vulnerability in MySQL (CVSS 9.8) to gain elevated privileges. The MySQL service is exposed on port 3306, which is commonly accessible. The initial access can be achieved through the Apache Tomcat service on port 8080, which is vulnerable to CVE-2021-4104 (CVSS 8.8), allowing remote code execution. This chain is realistic as both services are open and vulnerable, providing a clear path for exploitation.

mitre_chain.description: The attacker exploits the Apache Tomcat vulnerability (CVE-2021-4104) to execute arbitrary code on the server, gaining initial access.
mitre_chain.defensive_context: To prevent this, ensure that Apache Tomcat is updated to the latest version and apply security patches promptly.
mitre_chain.detection_ideas: Monitor logs for unusual access patterns or exploit attempts against the Tomcat service.

mitre_chain.description: After gaining access, the attacker exploits the MySQL privilege escalation vulnerability (CVE-2020-2574) to escalate privileges within the system.
mitre_chain.defensive_context: Regularly patch MySQL and restrict access to the database service to trusted IPs only.
mitre_chain.detection_ideas: Implement monitoring for privilege changes and unusual database access patterns.
